speaker: Frasier
text: What a glorious day!  Can't help but put a bounce in one's step, can it?

speaker: Roz
text: [_trying to open some aspirin_] If you're gonna be cheerful, sit somewhere else.  Damn it!  I broke a nail.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: If my life gets any worse, I'm phoning Hell to ask about their exchange program. [_He sits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, lucky me, I stumbled in at happy hour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here.  So, Niles, Maris at it again?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, worse.  It's so depressing I can barely talk about it. My gourmet club is holding elections to see who will win this year's Golden Apron...

speaker: Roz
text: Wait.  I can see I'm gonna need a hanky for this.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waiter_] Latte, please, to go.  Normally, the finalists compete by giving lectures.  I'd written mine, a waggish look at food fads of yesteryear entitled "Fondue: What Were We Thinking?"

speaker: Niles
text: Suddenly last night, disaster.  Someone proposed that instead of giving lectures, this year's finalists compete by hosting dinner parties in their homes.

speaker: Roz
text: So?  Why don't you invite 'em all over and cook 'em a meal?

speaker: Niles
text: At the Shangri-La?  I can't tell the cream of Seattle's gourmet set that I've moved out of the Montana and into that gulag with a game room.  I'll just have to drop out of the race.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's not be hasty.  Let's give this some thought.  Every problem has a solution.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you call that a problem?  A problem is when your kid keeps you up three nights in a row with colic, and you're so burned out you rear-end a Lexus, with four passengers, each and every one a lawyer, so you'll probably be sued and spend the rest of your working life, if you ever even GET a job, lining the pockets of four blood-sucking, whiplash-faking fat cats. THAT'S what a problem is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can you have it at a restaurant?

speaker: Niles
text: It's against the rules.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks for the sympathy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Niles
text: Sympathy for what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know, she broke a nail.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, Niles, try as I might, I can't think of a single thing. I'm sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't blame yourself.  Blame Claudia Kynock, the whole dinner scheme was her greedy notion.

speaker: Frasier
text: Claudia Kynock?  Kevin's widow?

speaker: Niles
text: Can you believe it?  She owns six newspapers and nine radio stations, she'll still cadge a free meal faster than that bulbous cartoon fellow who mooches hamburgers from Popeye. I know I must sound...

speaker: Frasier
text: Wimpy.

speaker: Niles
text: And whiny too.  But... I wanted this.  And after the year I've been through, I needed something to restore my pride, my dignity, my manhood.  That Golden Apron could do it.

speaker: Frasier
text: And you are going to have it.  You can have the dinner party at my house.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I'll tell you what: I'll rent an extra-large table and I'll share in the hosting chores.

speaker: Niles
text: You are a saint.

speaker: Niles
text: Though I did note you only offered after you found that out our club includes a rich station owner who could give you a job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, I must say I'm hurt.  I offer you something out of the goodness of my heart, you make it sound like I'm a shallow opportunist.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm terribly sorry.  How can I make it up to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  Sit me next to someone interesting.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Claudia, perhaps.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Put her on my left, it's my best side.   **SEOUL MATES**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Daphne is sitting on the couch with her friend Pam, drinking wine._

speaker: Pam
text: He actually marked the bottle so he'd know if you took some?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.  Then he marched into my room and confronted me with the evidence.  I said "All right.  If you want to be such a miser, then fine, I'll buy my own bath salts." _Martin comes in from his room, trying to act casual.  He is wearing a sweater which notably is the same garish-yet-typically-Martin one that Daphne gave him for Christmas in "Perspectives On Christmas" last season._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, Pam.  I didn't know you were here.

speaker: Daphne
text: I told you this morning she was coming by.

speaker: Martin
text: It musta slipped my mind.  Don't you look nice tonight.

speaker: Pam
text: You too, Martin.  I love your sweater.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, pretty cheerful, huh?  Not everyone can wear these colors.

speaker: Daphne
text: It helps if you're a matador. [_to Pam_] Come on, we don't want to be late for the movie.

speaker: Pam
text: Can I freshen up first?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, yeah, right through there.

speaker: Daphne
text: You dirty old man!  Flirting with a girl her age!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she was flirting right back.  I saw her giving me the once-over.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, she looked once and it was over.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've never acted this silly with any of my other girl friends.  What's so special about Pam?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, nothing.  She's just young and friendly, and... she reminds me of the girls I used to date back during the war.

speaker: Daphne
text: What, you mean Korea?  Mr. Crane, it's not dating when you're an occupying force.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just ask her if she's interested.

speaker: Daphne
text: Have you lost your mind?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, the gals in Pyong Chang used to think I was pretty damn cute.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah well, this is a bit different.  You're not twenty-one and her village hasn't just burned down.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not going to get her with a kind smile and a Hershey bar.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, just ask her, OK?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_grabbing her coat_] You know, this explains that so-called "mix-up" with those mail order videos.  Mistake my fanny, you ordered "The Joy Luck Club"!  _Niles and Frasier come in the front as Pam comes out of the powder room.  Martin sits in his chair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Dad, Daphne.  Pam, nice to see you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good night, all.

speaker: Martin
text: Pam?  _She turns to him, he waves goodbye and says something in Korean. From her confused look, we can tell that Martin has either butchered her language or said something extremely rude._

speaker: Daphne
text: Just keep moving.

speaker: Niles
text: What's with Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a Korea thing, don't ask.

speaker: Niles
text: [_on his cell phone_] Oh, my God!  He said yes, I've got him! [_hangs up_] That was a message from Marcel DeBoeuf!  He's agreed to cater my dinner for the gourmet club.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, that is a coup.

speaker: Martin
text: Who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Marcel DeBoeuf, Dad.  He's the famous sculpter-turned-chef. Each plate is a work of art. [_brings Niles his sherry_]

speaker: Niles
text: He's doing his all-truffle menu. [_Frasier gasps_] For the appetizer, he sculpts tiny mushroom trees, then he carves radishes to look like truffle pigs, snuffling around the roots.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Maybe I should do that for Eddie.  I could mold his Alpo into a cow.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs, then_] That reminds me...

speaker: Frasier
text: I got him Sonics tickets.

speaker: Martin
text: Bless you.  Oh!  And did I mention, they're predicting meteor showers for that evening!  So not only will I have a great meal, in a perfect setting...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: But we'll have nature itself putting on a show for us. [_points out to the balcony_] Oh, we'll have an excellent view from right... _He gasps suddenly, and moves closer to the balcony.  There is a large piece of tape across one of the windows._

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God, what's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's just a small crack, a little bird flew into it the other day.  I'm replacing the pane next week.

speaker: Niles
text: Next week?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's too late.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just a piece of tape!  No one will even notice.

speaker: Niles
text: You have no idea how cutthroat my rivals are.  They will leap on the tiniest imperfection.  Last night, Sebastian Melmoth threw a lavish Japanese banquet.  A certain rival spent the entire evening carping about how the _obis_ on the geishas' kimonos were improperly tied.

speaker: Frasier
text: "A certain rival?"

speaker: Niles
text: All right, me.

speaker: Martin
text: He had geishas?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's enough, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'll just have to have the party somewhere else.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Niles, you promised you'd have it here.  You promised me Claudia Kynock.

speaker: Martin
text: Nobody's gonna notice that window, and besides, who else is gonna loan you their place?  It's not like you can ask Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't have to ask her.  She's out of the country.  She's in Antwerp having her elbows done.  She has that stunning beach house.  I'm sure I can get past the alarm.

speaker: Martin
text: Isn't that breaking and entering?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, pish.  It can't be a crime if it's catered.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, I hope you have a lovely time.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't sulk Frasier.  You can still come.  I've got to start planning.  Wait 'til you see this place.  It's right on the beach, it's ideal for viewing the meteor shower.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe Chef Marcel can make your truffles look like little meteors zooming around the plates. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: We make fun of him, but every now and then he has a fantastic idea.   **NOT WHAT GOOD HOUSEKEEPING HAD IN MIND**  _Scene 3 - The Beach House Fade in.  Niles and Frasier are on the front porch opening the door. They each have garment bags, Niles has some flowers and Frasier has a grocery bag._

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope you're right about the alarm code, Niles.  People do change them.

speaker: Niles
text: Maris will never change this one.  _Niles opens the door, a beeping can be heard.  Cut to - the interior of the beach house as they enter._

speaker: Niles
text: It's her ideal weight.  What she weighed at her debutante ball.  [_He punches into a small key pad._] Let's see, this many pounds, and that many ounces.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, no one could weigh that and live!

speaker: Gretchen
text: [_off stage; German accent_] Maris!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, not her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Neighbor?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Gretchen Kuntz.  The old girl's been smitten with Maris ever since she taught falconry at Maris's finishing school. [_He hands Frasier the flowers._] Here, put these in water and I'll get rid of her.

speaker: Gretchen
text: [_o.s._] Maris, _liebchen_.  Is that you?

speaker: Gretchen
text: Oh, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Gretchen.

speaker: Gretchen
text: I'm surprised to see you here.  When last I spoke to Maris, she said your marriage had come to a timely end.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, it's all patched up now, we couldn't be happier. [_running water is heard from the kitchen_] In fact, that's Maris in the kitchen now.  We're terribly busy. [_calls_] I'll be right with you, muffin!  But I'll tell her you looked in.

speaker: Gretchen
text: Do.  Ask her to stop by.  My wolfhound had puppies. _Niles closes the door on her.  Frasier comes out with the flowers in a vase._

speaker: Niles
text: Let's get some lights on.  _He claps his hands and a rather garish lamp shaped like an anchor comes on._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, what the hell is that?

speaker: Niles
text: Maris had it made after she lost power in a storm.  Battery operated, works on a clapper [_claps it off_] so you can find it in the dark. [_claps it on_] Only problem was, the poor thing, try as she might, she could never clap hard enough to activate it.  _Frasier opens the curtains revealing the French doors to the back deck._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, this view is breathtaking!  You know, with a setting like this and Chef Marcel in the kitchen, I think that Golden Apron is as good as yours.

speaker: Niles
text: Well...  _They open the doors and step out.  Cut to - the rear deck.   The two take a deep breath of the sea air... and begin choking and gagging._

speaker: Niles
text: What is that revolting smell?!

speaker: Frasier
text: It smells like it's coming from the beach.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's like garbage or rotting fish...

speaker: Frasier
text: Or a dead seal.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's more like a rendering plant.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles.  There's an extremely large dead seal right by this dinghy.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, on the bright side, there's not a single crack in these windows.  _He closes the doors behind him.  Fade out.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - The Beach House Fade in.  Frasier and Niles are standing on the back deck.  Frasier has a handkerchief over his nose and mouth, Niles is on his cell phone._

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Animal Control?  A large seal washed up on my property, I need you to come remove it right away.  Its condition? It's deceased.  What?  Oh, you're not serious. [_to Frasier_] He says they only handle live seals. [_into phone_] What kind of policy is that?  If it were alive, I wouldn't need you, I could just scare it away myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd pay to see that.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait, I was mistaken.  It's not dead after all, it's sitting up.  It looks very disoriented.  Come quickly!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabbing the phone_] Give me that.  Hello, this is Frasier Crane.  You may remember me from my radio show.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, that should send the Seal Mobile racing over here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just how do you suggest we dispose of a dead seal?  I see. I see.  Charming. [_He closes the phone._] Well, we have two options.  We can either bury it or haul it out to sea, in which case they suggest we stab some holes in it.

speaker: Niles
text: Stab holes in it?

speaker: Frasier
text: To make it less buoyant.

speaker: Niles
text: It would certainly make me less buoyant.  Well, we'll have to bury it.  Help me find a shovel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.  That's Chef Marcel.  If he finds out what's out there, he will walk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Over a dead seal?

speaker: Niles
text: He won't let anything upstage his food.  He stormed out of Kate York's christening party over an ill-timed diaper change. You let him in, I'll find a shovel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Chef Marcel, this is indeed an honor.  I'm Frasier, Niles's brother...

speaker: Marcel
text: Where is my kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's, uh, right through there.

speaker: Marcel
text: What is that smell?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, what smell?

speaker: Marcel
text: Is there a baby here?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I mean, yes.  Well, there was a baby, but it's gone now, and we can air the place out.

speaker: Marcel
text: Do.  _He exits to the kitchen.  Niles comes down the stairs with two children's beach pail and shovel sets.  He hands one to Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: Al right, let's do this.  Quick, quick, quick.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's the matter, Niles, you couldn't find any _demitasse_ spoons?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry.  This is all we have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, for God's sake, it'll take us until doomsday with these things.  Let's just stick it in the dinghy and haul it out to sea, come on.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not touching that thing with my bare hands!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just go find a sheet or something to wrap it in.  _Niles head back upstairs.  Cut to - the deck as Frasier comes out and looks at the seal._

speaker: Frasier
text: Poor noble creature.  At least in death, you've achieved a kind of tragic dignity.

speaker: Niles
text: We can wrap it in this.  Quick, quick, quick.

speaker: Frasier
text: A peach peignoir?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and I found perfume.

speaker: Frasier
text: We're giving it a burial, Niles, not a day of beauty.

speaker: Niles
text: It's to cover the smell, and the peignoir was all I could find.  The beds were all stripped, the linen cupboard's locked.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, get on with it.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think that helped?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, Niles.  It smells so lovely now it's almost a shame to bury it.  Give me a hand with this.  All right, OK, now let's turn it over.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, have you ever seen anything so heartbreaking?  That sullied nightgown, that cold vacant stare, those limp little whiskers...

speaker: Frasier
text: Stick a corncob pipe in its mouth, it could be Nana on Dad's side.  Come on, let's go!  _The grab the seal.  Fade out.  Scene 2 - The Beach House Fade in.  Niles and Frasier are dragging the boat up onto the beach. They are soaking wet._

speaker: Niles
text: Nice oarsmanship, Mr. Oxford Rowing Champ!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not very easy to keep your balance when your crewmate jumps on your back and shrieks like a tea kettle.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  The thing's tongue lolled out and licked my ankle.  I just hope the wind changes before the party, they'll be here in fifteen minutes. [_sniffing_] The stench is so strong. I could almost swear the damn thing was still...  AH!  It's back!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, the tide must have washed it back in.  I knew we should have taken their advice and stabbed some holes in it.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  I refuse to even contemplate something so disgusting. We'll just row it back out, only this time we'll weigh it down with something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, what about that hideous anchor lamp?

speaker: Niles
text: Perfect.  We'll tie it to the peignoir's sash, it'll sink like a brick. [_checks his watch_] Would you mind terribly doing that alone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Alone?!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I have to get ready.  Frasier, please, I beg you.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles.  But the entire time I'm gone, you'd better be singing my praises to Claudia Kynock.

speaker: Niles
text: Done.

speaker: Marcel
text: Excuse me, where do you keep the...

speaker: Niles
text: Chef Marcel, it's so nice to meet you at last!

speaker: Marcel
text: You have been swimming?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a dip.

speaker: Marcel
text: In your clotheses?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it is November.  You know, it was so refreshing, I think I'll go back for another.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't forget your lamp.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_off Marcel's look_] It's getting dark in that water.   **THERE FETE IS SEALED**  _Scene 3 - The Beach House Fade in.  Niles, in his tuxedo is circulating around the living room which is filled with people._

speaker: Niles
text: Sebastian, you must try one of these truffled scallops.

speaker: Sebastian
text: I'm allergic to bivalves, a good host would know that.

speaker: Claudia
text: Don't mind Sebastian, he's just afraid you'll outshine his geisha party.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, no rivalries, we're all friends tonight.  And I'm sorry about the scallops.  In the future, I'll try to cater more to your shellfish demands. [_moves off_]

speaker: Sebastian
text: [_after a pause, then irritated_] I got that!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thank God you're back.  I can open the deck?  People are beginning to get suspicious.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hauled it out as far as I could.  I just hope that lamp is heavy enough.  Is Claudia here?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and she's dying to talk to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good.  Smell my fingers.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sniffing_] Ooh, lovely.  Tubla root?

speaker: Frasier
text: Jasmine.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?  Everyone?  As you may know, I've arranged a small meteor shower for our entertainment this evening. [_laughter_] So feel free to claim your spots now on the observation deck.

speaker: Niles
text: Claudia.  This is my brother Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Claudia
text: Oh, well.  Just the man I wanted to meet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, now I should warn you, Claudia's in radio, so you're probably in for more of that arm-twisting you've been getting from so many of those other station owners.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my brother, the publicist.  Before long, he'll be telling you about my two SeaBeas and my Broadcaster of the Year award.

speaker: Claudia
text: Well, now we don't have to talk all business.  But I do want to mention that we may be replacing one of our nationally syndicated hosts, The Happy Traveler.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  The Happy Traveler. How's that coming?

speaker: Claudia
text: Not well.  Unless they get more realistic with those ransom demands, he's never coming out of that jungle.

speaker: Sebastian
text: There certainly are a lot of gnats buzzing around out here.

speaker: Claudia
text: Yes, there are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, allow me.  _He smacks his hand together over a bug.  The noise activates the anchor lamp which is now on the beach with the seal._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Sebastian
text: There were no bugs at my party.  _Sebastian smacks a gnat on his face, activating the lamp, Niles claps it off._

speaker: Claudia
text: What's that on the beach?

speaker: Sebastian
text: I don't know, but it's wearing a boa.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  That's preposterous.  It's just a rock with some seaweed on it. _Another guest smacks at an insect, the lamp goes on, Niles claps it off._

speaker: Claudia
text: Niles, there seems to be something with feathers flashing at us.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, that's my neighbor.  Don't clap, it just encourages her.

speaker: Claudia
text: Does anyone else smell something?

speaker: Niles
text: I know what I smell! [_He takes a deep breath and chokes._] Truffles!

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone, time for dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, step lively.  Mm-mmm.  Truffles.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, get out there and stab that thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I'm sick to death of chaperoning that carcass.

speaker: Niles
text: Well I can't do it, I'm the host.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, because of that woman in there and a scrappy band of Third World rebels, I am this close to getting a national radio show of my own.  You have to do it.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  Get me a knife, close those curtains and don't let anyone out on this deck until I come back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Where's the damn thing gone to?

speaker: Niles
text: Got it, thanks.  _He claps his hands and the light goes out.  Fade out.  Scene 4 - The Beach House Fade in.  Frasier is on the sofa with Claudia._

speaker: Claudia
text: I've listened to your show.  And what impressed me most is your ability to focus.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I'm very proud of that.  I try to give each of my callers my complete, undivided... [_He notices Sebastian headed for the deck._] Excuse me.  Would you please just stay inside?  We're about to start dinner.

speaker: Sebastian
text: You said that ten minutes ago.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, so it's even truer now, isn't it?  Just sit down. [_Frasier sits back down with Claudia._] I'm sorry.  Back to my show.

speaker: Claudia
text: I must say, I was wondering myself when we'd be eating. It's getting late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles is in the kitchen, right now, trying to prod Marcel along.  You know how it is with these perfectionists.

speaker: Marcel
text: I am waiting to serve.  Where is Niles?

speaker: Claudia
text: You mean he's not with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure he's around here somewhere.  You know, perhaps he's upstairs making a phone call.  If you could just keep everything warm, I'm sure he'll be down in a minute.

speaker: Marcel
text: He'd better be.  I reheat for no one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm terribly sorry about all these interruptions. Now, let's get back to that job.

speaker: Claudia
text: Well, you'd be in ninety-three markets...

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, can I help you?

speaker: Guest
text: I just saw a meteor.

speaker: Claudia
text: Oh, have they started?

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, everyone, stand back and witness the spectacular view through this transom.

speaker: Claudia
text: Can't we see them better outside?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it's much safer in here.  You see, you never know where they might land.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps that's Niles.

speaker: McLean
text: Hello, is Niles Crane here?  We're investigating a possible homicide.

speaker: Claudia
text: What?

speaker: McLean
text: Your neighbor saw Dr. Crane and another man row out to sea with a third party dressed in a nightie.  The men returned alone.  We suspect they dumped the body overboard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh... all right, now, now, there's nothing to be alarmed about.  Please gentlemen, come in, you see, I can clear this whole thing up.  You see, I was the other man in the rowboat.

speaker: Claudia
text: You dumped a body overboard?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Gretchen
text: Thank God you're here!  I just saw a murder!

speaker: Claudia
text: What?

speaker: Gretchen
text: Dr. Crane was on the beach with his wife, Maris.  I recognized her peignoir.  I could even smell her perfume.  He was stabbing her again and again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, no, clearly this woman is delusional.  Listen, search the entire house, I defy you to find one scrap of evidence that there's been foul play here.

speaker: Marcel
text: [_from the kitchen doorway_] My butcher knife has disappeared from the kitchen.

speaker: McLean
text: [_to his partner_] Go check the beach.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, people, I assure you there is nothing sinister going on here. _The officer opens the drapes, revealing Niles standing on the deck, wearing gloves and wiping blood off the butcher knife with his handkerchief.  Noticing the officer, he throws them both over his shoulder.  He comes in and the officer rushes to the beach._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all.  Meteor shower's started.  Oh, excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, there's been a little misunderstanding.  Perhaps it's time you explained to everyone about the dead seal.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] Dead seal?  At my Golden Apron dinner?  That's enough bubbly for you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, they think you murdered Maris!

speaker: Gretchen
text: I saw him stabbing her!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I see what's happened!  Oh, this is funny!  Oh, you are all going to laugh when you hear this.  I was simply stabbing a seal.

speaker: Claudia
text: You killed a seal?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no, I didn't kill it, it was already dead when we found it.

speaker: McLean
text: You found a dead seal?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: McLean
text: And it was wearing a peignoir?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now that is ludicrous.  We put the pegnoir on it.

speaker: McLean
text: And the perfume too?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: McLean
text: So you found a dead seal, dressed it in a peignoir, doused it in perfume, and stabbed it?

speaker: Niles
text: I told you you'd laugh.

speaker: Athanis
text: I found this washed up on the beach.

speaker: Niles
text: Well there, if that doesn't prove my innocence, I don't know what does.

speaker: Gretchen
text: _Gott im himmel_!  It's covered in her blood!

speaker: Marcel
text: Dinner is served.

speaker: McLean
text: Sorry folks, no one can leave.  This is a crime scene.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it certainly would be a crime if we missed that dinner! Everyone, sit down!  There's place cards all around the table.

speaker: Athanis
text: OK, gentlemen, let's go.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, he said no one can leave.

speaker: Frasier
text: Claudia, perhaps we can discuss that job tomorrow.  You know, I've got some business cards in my breast pocket if you'd like to fish one out.  No?  Fine, I'll just call you then.

speaker: Niles
text: Officer?  You can't arrest me.  My wife is alive!  She's in Antwerp, getting her elbows done!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, give it up, Niles, even I didn't believe that one.
